title: Relates to regulation of toxic chemicals in children's products
summary: Relates to regulation of toxic chemicals in children's products; establishes the interstate chemical clearinghouse.

       AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to regu-
         lation of toxic chemicals in children's products

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Article 37 of the environmental conservation law is amended
    2  by adding a new title 7 to read as follows:
    3                                  TITLE VII
    4                   TOXIC CHEMICALS IN CHILDREN'S PRODUCTS
    5  SECTION 37-0701. DEFINITIONS.
    6          37-0703. CHEMICALS OF HIGH CONCERN.
    7          37-0705. PRIORITY CHEMICALS.
    8          37-0707. DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION ON PRIORITY CHEMICALS.
    9          37-0709. SALES PROHIBITION.
   10          37-0711. APPLICABILITY.
   11          37-0713. ENFORCEMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION.
   12          37-0715. INTERSTATE CHEMICAL CLEARINGHOUSE.
   13          37-0717. REGULATIONS.
   14  S 37-0701. DEFINITIONS.
   15    AS  USED  IN  THIS  TITLE, UNLESS THE CONTEXT OTHERWISE INDICATES, THE
   16  FOLLOWING TERMS HAVE THE FOLLOWING MEANINGS.
   17    1. "CHILDREN'S APPAREL" MEANS ANY ITEM OF CLOTHING  THAT  CONSISTS  OF
   18  FABRIC  OR  RELATED  MATERIAL INTENDED OR PROMOTED FOR USE IN CHILDREN'S
   19  CLOTHING. CHILDREN'S APPAREL DOES NOT MEAN PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT DESIGNED

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03600-01-1

       A. 3141                             2

    1  TO PREVENT INJURY, INCLUDING,  BUT  NOT  LIMITED  TO,  BICYCLE  HELMETS,
    2  ATHLETIC SUPPORTERS, KNEE PADS OR ELBOW PADS.
    3    2.  "CHEMICAL" MEANS A SUBSTANCE WITH A DISTINCT MOLECULAR COMPOSITION
    4  OR A GROUP OF STRUCTURALLY RELATED SUBSTANCES AND INCLUDES THE BREAKDOWN
    5  PRODUCTS OF THE SUBSTANCE OR SUBSTANCES THAT FORM THROUGH DECOMPOSITION,
    6  DEGRADATION OR METABOLISM.
    7    3. "CHEMICAL OF HIGH CONCERN" MEANS A CHEMICAL INCLUDED IN THE LIST OF
    8  "CHEMICALS OF HIGH CONCERN" PUBLISHED IN JUNE 2009 PURSUANT  TO  CHAPTER
    9  16-D OF TITLE 38 OF THE MAINE REVISED STATUTES ANNOTATED.
   10    4. "CHILDREN" MEANS A PERSON OR PERSONS AGED TWELVE AND UNDER.
   11    5.  "CHILDREN'S PRODUCT" MEANS A PRODUCT PRIMARILY INTENDED FOR USE BY
   12  CHILDREN, INCLUDING EXTERNAL COMPONENT PARTS  AND  PACKAGING,  INCLUDING
   13  BABY  PRODUCTS,  TOYS,  CAR  SEATS,  PERSONAL  CARE  PRODUCTS, A PRODUCT
   14  DESIGNED OR INTENDED BY THE MANUFACTURER TO HELP A CHILD WITH SUCKING OR
   15  TEETHING, TO FACILITATE SLEEP, RELAXATION, OR THE FEEDING  OF  A  CHILD,
   16  JEWELRY,  NOVELTY  PRODUCTS, BEDDING, FURNITURE, FURNISHINGS, CHILDREN'S
   17  APPAREL, AND THE HOUSING OF CONSUMER ELECTRONIC PRODUCTS.    "CHILDREN'S
   18  PRODUCT"  DOES  NOT  INCLUDE  (A)  BATTERIES; OR (B) CONSUMER ELECTRONIC
   19  PRODUCTS ENCLOSED WITHIN A SECURE HOUSING, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED  TO
   20  PERSONAL  COMPUTERS,  AUDIO  AND  VIDEO EQUIPMENT, CALCULATORS, WIRELESS
   21  PHONES, GAME  CONSOLES,  AND  HANDHELD  DEVICES  INCORPORATING  A  VIDEO
   22  SCREEN, USED TO ACCESS INTERACTIVE SOFTWARE AND THEIR ASSOCIATED PERIPH-
   23  ERALS,  EXCEPT  FOR SAID SECURE HOUSING; OR (C) A FOOD OR BEVERAGE OR AN
   24  ADDITIVE TO A FOOD OR BEVERAGE REGULATED BY THE UNITED STATES  FOOD  AND
   25  DRUG  ADMINISTRATION;  OR (D) A TOBACCO PRODUCT OR PAPER OR FOREST PROD-
   26  UCT; OR (E) A PESTICIDE REGULATED BY  THE  UNITED  STATES  ENVIRONMENTAL
   27  PROTECTION  AGENCY.    CHILDREN'S  PRODUCT ALSO DOES NOT INCLUDE A DRUG,
   28  BIOLOGIC OR MEDICAL DEVICE REGULATED BY THE UNITED STATES FOOD AND  DRUG
   29  ADMINISTRATION OR THE PACKAGING OF SUCH DRUG, BIOLOGIC OR MEDICAL DEVICE
   30  IF SUCH PACKAGING IS REGULATED BY THE UNITED STATES FOOD AND DRUG ADMIN-
   31  ISTRATION.
   32    6.  "DISTRIBUTOR"  MEANS  A  PERSON  WHO  SELLS CHILDREN'S PRODUCTS TO
   33  RETAIL ESTABLISHMENTS ON A WHOLESALE BASIS.
   34    7. "INTENTIONALLY ADDED" MEANS THE DELIBERATE USE IN  THE  FORMULATION
   35  OF  A  PRODUCT OR SUBPART WHERE ITS CONTINUED PRESENCE IS DESIRED IN THE
   36  FINAL PRODUCT OR SUBPART TO PROVIDE A SPECIFIC  CHARACTERISTIC,  APPEAR-
   37  ANCE OR QUALITY.
   38    8.  "MANUFACTURER" MEANS ANY PERSON WHO CURRENTLY MANUFACTURES A FINAL
   39  CHILDREN'S PRODUCT OR WHOSE BRAND NAME  IS  AFFIXED  TO  THE  CHILDREN'S
   40  PRODUCT.  IN THE CASE OF A CHILDREN'S PRODUCT THAT WAS IMPORTED INTO THE
   41  UNITED STATES, "MANUFACTURER" INCLUDES THE IMPORTER  OR  FIRST  DOMESTIC
   42  DISTRIBUTOR  OF THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT IF THE PERSON WHO CURRENTLY MANU-
   43  FACTURES OR ASSEMBLES THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT  OR  WHOSE  BRAND  NAME  IS
   44  AFFIXED TO THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT DOES NOT HAVE A PRESENCE IN THE UNITED
   45  STATES.
   46    9.  "NOVELTY  PRODUCT" MEANS A PRODUCT INTENDED MAINLY FOR PERSONAL OR
   47  HOUSEHOLD ENJOYMENT OR ADORNMENT. NOVELTY PRODUCTS INCLUDE, BUT ARE  NOT
   48  LIMITED TO, ITEMS INTENDED FOR USE AS PRACTICAL JOKES, FIGURINES, ADORN-
   49  MENTS, TOYS, GAMES, CARDS, ORNAMENTS, YARD STATUES AND FIGURES, CANDLES,
   50  JEWELRY, HOLIDAY DECORATIONS, OR SIMILAR PRODUCTS.
   51    10. "PRIORITY CHEMICAL" MEANS (A) THE FOLLOWING CHEMICALS:
   52    CASRN115-96-8     TRIS (2-CHLOROETHYL) PHOSPHATE
   53    CASRN71-43-2      BENZENE
   54    CASRN7439-92-1    LEAD AND COMPOUNDS (INORGANIC)
   55    CASRN7439-97-6    MERCURY AND MERCURY COMPOUNDS, INCLUDING METHYL
   56                      MERCURY (CASRN 22967-92-6)

       A. 3141                             3

    1    CASRN7439-98-7    MOLYBDENUM AND MOLYBDENUM COMPOUNDS
    2    CASRN7440-36-0    ANTIMONY AND ANTIMONY COMPOUNDS
    3    CASRN7440-38-2    ARSENIC AND ARSENIC COMPOUNDS INCLUDING ARSENIC
    4                      TRIOXIDE (CASRN 1327-53-3)
    5                      AND DIMETHYL ARSENIC (CASRN 75-60-5)
    6    CASRN7440-41-7    BERYLLIUM AND BERYLLIUM COMPOUNDS
    7    CASRN7440-43-9    CADMIUM
    8    CASRN7440-48-4    COBALT AND COBALT COMPOUNDS AND
    9    (B)  A  CHEMICAL ADOPTED BY THE DEPARTMENT PURSUANT TO SECTION 37-0505
   10  OF THIS TITLE.
   11    11. "TOY" MEANS A PRODUCT DESIGNED OR INTENDED BY THE MANUFACTURER  TO
   12  BE USED BY A CHILD AT PLAY.
   13  S 37-0703. CHEMICALS OF HIGH CONCERN.
   14    1. PUBLISHING OF LIST. WITHIN ONE HUNDRED EIGHTY DAYS OF THE EFFECTIVE
   15  DATE  OF THIS TITLE, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL ENSURE THAT A WEBSITE ACCESSI-
   16  BLE TO THE PUBLIC IS ESTABLISHED  WHICH  LISTS  ALL  CHEMICALS  OF  HIGH
   17  CONCERN.
   18    2.  PERIODIC  REVIEW.  (A) WITH RESOURCES MADE AVAILABLE THEREFOR, THE
   19  DEPARTMENT, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH,  MAY  PERIOD-
   20  ICALLY  REVIEW  THE LIST OF CHEMICALS OF HIGH CONCERN AND, THROUGH REGU-
   21  LATION, IDENTIFY ADDITIONAL CHEMICALS OF HIGH CONCERN, OR REMOVE A CHEM-
   22  ICAL FROM THE LIST OF CHEMICALS OF HIGH CONCERN BASED ON  EVIDENCE  THAT
   23  THE  CHEMICAL DOES NOT MEET THE CRITERIA OF THIS SUBDIVISION, INCLUDING,
   24  BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PESTICIDES AND CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES. IN  THE  EVENT
   25  THAT  A  NEW  DETERMINATION IS MADE BY A STATE, FEDERAL OR INTERNATIONAL
   26  GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY THAT A CHEMICAL MEETS  THE  HIGH  CONCERN  CRITERIA,
   27  NOTHING  HEREIN  SHALL  PREVENT  THE  DEPARTMENT FROM ACTING TO ADD SUCH
   28  CHEMICALS OUTSIDE OF THE PERIODIC REVIEW PROCESS.
   29    (B) THE DEPARTMENT SHALL, UPON THIS REVIEW, IDENTIFY A CHEMICAL  AS  A
   30  CHEMICAL  OF  HIGH  CONCERN  IF IT DETERMINES THAT THE CHEMICAL HAS BEEN
   31  IDENTIFIED BY A STATE, FEDERAL OR INTERNATIONAL GOVERNMENTAL  ENTITY  ON
   32  THE BASIS OF CREDIBLE SCIENTIFIC EVIDENCE AS:
   33    (I)  A  CARCINOGEN,  A  REPRODUCTIVE  OR  DEVELOPMENTAL TOXICANT OR AN
   34  ENDOCRINE DISRUPTOR;
   35    (II) PERSISTENT, BIOACCUMULATIVE AND TOXIC; OR
   36    (III) VERY PERSISTENT AND VERY BIOACCUMULATIVE.
   37    (C) IN MAKING SUCH DETERMINATION, THE DEPARTMENT MAY CONSIDER  BUT  IS
   38  NOT LIMITED TO CONSIDERING:
   39    (I)  CHEMICALS IDENTIFIED AS "GROUP 1 CARCINOGENS" OR "GROUP 2A CARCI-
   40  NOGENS" BY THE  WORLD  HEALTH  ORGANIZATION,  INTERNATIONAL  AGENCY  FOR
   41  RESEARCH ON CANCER;
   42    (II)  CHEMICALS  IDENTIFIED  AS  "KNOWN  TO BE A HUMAN CARCINOGEN" AND
   43  "REASONABLY ANTICIPATED TO BE A HUMAN CARCINOGEN" BY  THE  SECRETARY  OF
   44  THE  UNITED  STATES  DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES PURSUANT TO
   45  THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE ACT, 42 UNITED STATES CODE, SECTION 241(B)(4),
   46  AS AMENDED;
   47    (III) CHEMICALS IDENTIFIED AS "GROUP A CARCINOGENS" OR "GROUP B CARCI-
   48  NOGENS" BY THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY;
   49    (IV) CHEMICALS IDENTIFIED AS REPRODUCTIVE OR  DEVELOPMENTAL  TOXICANTS
   50  BY:
   51    (A)  THE  UNITED  STATES  DEPARTMENT  OF  HEALTH  AND  HUMAN SERVICES,
   52  NATIONAL TOXICOLOGY PROGRAM, CENTER FOR THE EVALUATION OF RISKS TO HUMAN
   53  REPRODUCTION; AND
   54    (B) THE CALIFORNIA ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY, OFFICE OF ENVIRON-
   55  MENTAL HEALTH HAZARD ASSESSMENT PURSUANT TO THE  CALIFORNIA  HEALTH  AND

       A. 3141                             4

    1  SAFETY  CODE,  SAFE  DRINKING  WATER  AND TOXIC ENFORCEMENT ACT OF 1986,
    2  CHAPTER 6.6, SECTION 25249.8;
    3    (V) CHEMICALS IDENTIFIED AS A CHEMICAL OF HIGH CONCERN FOR CHILDREN OR
    4  A  HIGH  PRIORITY  CHEMICAL OF HIGH CONCERN FOR CHILDREN BY THE STATE OF
    5  WASHINGTON DEPARTMENT OF ECOLOGY, PURSUANT  TO  CHAPTER  70.240  OF  THE

    7    (VI) CHEMICALS OF HIGH CONCERN AS SUCH CHEMICALS ARE IDENTIFIED BY THE
    8  STATE  OF MAINE'S DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION AND APPEARING
    9  ON SUCH DEPARTMENT'S LIST OF CHEMICALS OF HIGH CONCERN;
   10    (VII) CHEMICALS IDENTIFIED AS KNOWN  OR  LIKELY  ENDOCRINE  DISRUPTORS
   11  THROUGH  SCREENING  OR  TESTING  CONDUCTED  IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROTOCOLS
   12  DEVELOPED BY THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY  PURSUANT
   13  TO THE UNITED STATES FOOD, DRUG AND COSMETIC ACT, 21 UNITED STATES CODE,
   14  346A(P),  AS  AMENDED BY THE FEDERAL FOOD QUALITY PROTECTION ACT (PUBLIC
   15  LAW 104-170) OR THE FEDERAL SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT,  42  UNITED  STATES
   16  CODE, SECTION 300J-17;
   17    (VIII)  CHEMICALS  LISTED ON THE BASIS OF ENDOCRINE-DISRUPTING PROPER-
   18  TIES IN ANNEX XIV, LIST OF SUBSTANCES SUBJECT  TO  AUTHORISATION,  REGU-
   19  LATION  (EC)  NO  1907/2006  OF  THE  EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT CONCERNING THE
   20  REGISTRATION, EVALUATION, AUTHORISATION AND RESTRICTION OF CHEMICALS;
   21    (IX) PERSISTENT, BIOACCUMULATIVE AND  TOXIC  CHEMICALS  IDENTIFIED  BY
   22  OTHER STATES OR THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY;
   23    (X)  A  VERY PERSISTENT, VERY BIOACCUMULATIVE CHEMICAL LISTED IN ANNEX
   24  XIV, LIST OF SUBSTANCES SUBJECT TO  AUTHORISATION,  REGULATION  (EC)  NO
   25  1907/2006 OF THE EUROPEAN PARLIAMENT CONCERNING THE REGISTRATION, EVALU-
   26  ATION, AUTHORIZATION AND RESTRICTION OF CHEMICALS; AND
   27    (XI) A PERSISTENT BIOACCUMULATIVE TOXIC CHEMICAL AS DEFINED IN CHAPTER
   28  173-333 OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON ADMINISTRATIVE CODE.
   29  S 37-0705. PRIORITY CHEMICALS.
   30    1. PUBLISHING OF LIST. WITHIN ONE HUNDRED EIGHTY DAYS OF THE EFFECTIVE
   31  DATE  OF THIS TITLE, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL ENSURE THAT A WEBSITE ACCESSI-
   32  BLE TO THE PUBLIC IS ESTABLISHED WHICH LISTS ALL PRIORITY CHEMICALS.
   33    2. PERIODIC REVIEW. (A) WITH RESOURCES MADE  AVAILABLE  THEREFOR,  THE
   34  DEPARTMENT,  IN  CONSULTATION WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH, MAY PERIOD-
   35  ICALLY REVIEW THE LIST OF PRIORITY CHEMICALS  AND,  THROUGH  REGULATION,
   36  IDENTIFY  ADDITIONAL  PRIORITY  CHEMICALS  OR REMOVE A CHEMICAL FROM THE
   37  LIST OF PRIORITY CHEMICALS BASED ON EVIDENCE THAT THE  CHEMICAL  IS  NOT
   38  PRESENT  IN  A  CHILDREN'S PRODUCT OR OTHERWISE SHOULD NOT BE SUBJECT TO
   39  THE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS TITLE.  IN THE EVENT THAT A  NEW  DETERMINATION
   40  IS  MADE BY A STATE, FEDERAL OR INTERNATIONAL GOVERNMENTAL ENTITY THAT A
   41  CHEMICAL MEETS THE PRIORITY  CHEMICAL  CRITERIA,  NOTHING  HEREIN  SHALL
   42  PREVENT  THE DEPARTMENT FROM ACTING TO ADD SUCH CHEMICALS OUTSIDE OF THE
   43  PERIODIC REVIEW PROCESS.
   44    (B) THE DEPARTMENT MAY IDENTIFY A CHEMICAL AS A PRIORITY CHEMICAL  IF,
   45  UPON  SUCH  REVIEW,  IT DETERMINES THAT A CHEMICAL OF HIGH CONCERN MEETS
   46  ANY OF THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA:
   47    (I) THE CHEMICAL OR ITS METABOLITES HAVE BEEN FOUND  THROUGH  BIOMONI-
   48  TORING  TO  BE  PRESENT IN HUMANS, INCLUDING HUMAN BLOOD, UMBILICAL CORD
   49  BLOOD, BREAST MILK, URINE OR OTHER BODILY TISSUES OR FLUIDS;
   50    (II) THE CHEMICAL HAS BEEN FOUND THROUGH SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS  TO  BE
   51  PRESENT  IN  HOUSEHOLD  DUST, INDOOR AIR, DRINKING WATER OR ELSEWHERE IN
   52  THE HOME ENVIRONMENT;
   53    (III) THE CHEMICAL HAS BEEN FOUND THROUGH MONITORING TO BE PRESENT  IN
   54  FISH, WILDLIFE OR THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT;
   55    (IV)  THE  CHEMICAL IS PRESENT IN A CHILDREN'S PRODUCT USED OR PRESENT
   56  IN THE HOME, SCHOOL, OR CHILDCARE CENTER;

       A. 3141                             5

    1    (V) THE CHEMICAL HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED AS A HIGH PRODUCTION VOLUME CHEM-
    2  ICAL BY THE UNITED STATES ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY; OR
    3    (VI) THE SALE OR USE OF THE CHEMICAL OR A PRODUCT CONTAINING THE CHEM-
    4  ICAL HAS BEEN BANNED IN ANOTHER STATE OR STATES WITHIN THE UNITED STATES
    5  BECAUSE OF THE HEALTH EFFECTS OF SUCH CHEMICAL.
    6    (C)  IF  A  CHEMICAL  IS REMOVED FROM THE LISTING OF CHEMICALS OF HIGH
    7  CONCERN, IT SHALL ALSO BE UNDESIGNATED AS A PRIORITY CHEMICAL.
    8  S 37-0707. DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION ON PRIORITY CHEMICALS.
    9    1. REPORTING OF CHEMICAL USE. NO LATER  THAN  TWELVE  MONTHS  AFTER  A
   10  PRIORITY  CHEMICAL  IS  LISTED ON THE LIST PUBLISHED PURSUANT TO SECTION
   11  37-0705 OF THIS TITLE, EVERY MANUFACTURER WHO OFFERS A CHILDREN'S  PROD-
   12  UCT  FOR  SALE  OR  DISTRIBUTION  IN  THIS STATE THAT CONTAINS AN INTEN-
   13  TIONALLY ADDED PRIORITY CHEMICAL SHALL NOTIFY THE DEPARTMENT IN  A  FORM
   14  PRESCRIBED  BY  THE  DEPARTMENT,  DEVELOPED  IN COLLABORATION WITH OTHER
   15  STATES AND AN INTERSTATE CHEMICALS CLEARINGHOUSE AS PROVIDED IN  SECTION
   16  37-0715 OF THIS TITLE.
   17    (A) THIS NOTICE MUST AT A MINIMUM IDENTIFY THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT, THE
   18  PRIORITY  CHEMICAL OR CHEMICALS CONTAINED IN THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT, AND
   19  THE INTENDED PURPOSE OF THE CHEMICALS IN THE CHILDREN'S  PRODUCT.    ALL
   20  INFORMATION  SUBMITTED  PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL BE SUBJECT TO
   21  DISCLOSURE TO THE PUBLIC.   CONSISTENT  WITH  NOTIFICATION  REQUIRED  BY
   22  OTHER STATES, THE DEPARTMENT MAY ALSO REQUIRE REPORTING OF THE FOLLOWING
   23  INFORMATION:
   24    (I)  THE  POTENTIAL  FOR HARM TO HUMAN HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENT FROM
   25  SPECIFIC USES OF THE PRIORITY CHEMICAL;
   26    (II) THE AMOUNT OF SUCH CHEMICAL IN EACH UNIT OF THE CHILDREN'S  PROD-
   27  UCT, EXPRESSED IN A RANGE;
   28    (III) INFORMATION ON THE LIKELIHOOD THAT THE CHEMICAL WILL BE RELEASED
   29  FROM THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT TO THE ENVIRONMENT DURING THE PRODUCT'S LIFE
   30  CYCLE  AND  THE  EXTENT  TO  WHICH USERS OF THE PRODUCT ARE LIKELY TO BE
   31  EXPOSED TO THE CHEMICAL;
   32    (IV) INFORMATION ON THE EXTENT TO WHICH THE CHEMICAL IS PRESENT IN THE
   33  ENVIRONMENT OR HUMAN BODY.
   34    (B) IN LIEU OF PROVIDING THIS NOTICE TO THE DEPARTMENT, THE DEPARTMENT
   35  IS AUTHORIZED TO DIRECT SUBMISSION OF  SUCH  NOTICE  TO  THE  INTERSTATE
   36  CHEMICALS CLEARINGHOUSE PURSUANT TO SECTION 37-0715 OF THIS TITLE.
   37    2.  ASSESSMENT OF ALTERNATIVE CHEMICALS.  IN ADDITION, CONSISTENT WITH
   38  OTHER STATES, THE DEPARTMENT MAY REQUIRE THAT THE  MANUFACTURER  PROVIDE
   39  AN  ASSESSMENT  OF  THE AVAILABILITY, COST, FEASIBILITY AND PERFORMANCE,
   40  INCLUDING POTENTIAL FOR HARM TO HUMAN HEALTH  AND  THE  ENVIRONMENT,  OF
   41  ALTERNATIVES TO THE PRIORITY CHEMICAL AND THE REASON THE PRIORITY CHEMI-
   42  CAL  IS  USED  IN  THE MANUFACTURER OF THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT IN LIEU OF
   43  IDENTIFIED ALTERNATIVES. THE  DEPARTMENT  SHALL  HOLD  CONFIDENTIAL  ANY
   44  INFORMATION DISCLOSED PURSUANT TO THIS SUBDIVISION CONCERNING THE CHEMI-
   45  CAL  OR CONSUMER PRODUCT THAT IF MADE PUBLIC, WOULD DIVULGE CONFIDENTIAL
   46  BUSINESS INFORMATION, METHODS OR PROCESSES  ENTITLED  TO  PROTECTION  AS
   47  TRADE  SECRETS,  EXCEPT  THAT  SUCH  INFORMATION MAY BE DISCLOSED TO ANY
   48  OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES OR AUTHORIZED REPRESENTATIVES OF THE STATE CONCERNED
   49  WITH CARRYING OUT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS TITLE.
   50    3. WAIVER OF  REPORTING.  UPON  APPLICATION  BY  A  MANUFACTURER,  THE
   51  COMMISSIONER MAY WAIVE ALL OR PART OF THE NOTIFICATION REQUIREMENT UNDER
   52  SUBDIVISION  ONE  OF  THIS  SECTION  FOR ONE OR MORE SPECIFIED USES OF A
   53  PRIORITY CHEMICAL. IN MAKING SUCH DETERMINATION,  THE  COMMISSIONER  MAY
   54  CONSIDER:  (A)  SIMILAR WAIVERS GRANTED BY OTHER STATES, AND (B) WHETHER
   55  THE SPECIFIED USE OR USES ARE MINOR IN VOLUME.

       A. 3141                             6

    1    4. NOTICE TO RETAILERS. A MANUFACTURER OR DISTRIBUTOR OF A  CHILDREN'S
    2  PRODUCT  CONTAINING  A PRIORITY CHEMICAL SHALL NOTIFY PERSONS THAT OFFER
    3  THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT FOR SALE OR DISTRIBUTION  IN  THE  STATE  OF  THE
    4  PRESENCE OF SUCH PRIORITY CHEMICAL, AND PROVIDE SUCH PERSONS WITH INFOR-
    5  MATION REGARDING THE TOXICITY OF SUCH CHEMICAL.
    6    5.  FEES.  THE  MANUFACTURER  OR  DISTRIBUTOR  SHALL  PAY  A  FEE UPON
    7  SUBMISSION OF A REPORT OF CHEMICAL USE OR A WAIVER REQUEST TO COVER  THE
    8  DEPARTMENT'S  REASONABLE  COSTS IN MANAGING THE INFORMATION COLLECTED OR
    9  IN MAKING A WAIVER DETERMINATION, IN THE AMOUNT OF SIX  HUNDRED  DOLLARS
   10  PER CHEMICAL.
   11  S 37-0709. SALES PROHIBITION.
   12    UPON TWO YEARS AFTER THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS TITLE, NO PERSON SHALL
   13  DISTRIBUTE,  SELL  OR OFFER FOR SALE IN THIS STATE AN ITEM OF CHILDREN'S
   14  APPAREL OR A CHILDREN'S NOVELTY PRODUCT CONTAINING A PRIORITY  CHEMICAL.
   15  THIS PROVISION SHALL NOT APPLY TO AN ITEM OF CHILDREN'S APPAREL OR CHIL-
   16  DREN'S  NOVELTY  SOLELY  BASED  ON ITS CONTAINING AN ENCLOSED BATTERY OR
   17  ENCLOSED ELECTRONIC COMPONENTS.
   18  S 37-0711. APPLICABILITY.
   19    1. NEW CHILDREN'S PRODUCTS. THE PROVISIONS OF THIS TITLE  SHALL  APPLY
   20  TO  CHEMICALS IN CHILDREN'S PRODUCTS SOLD OR DISTRIBUTED AS NEW AND DOES
   21  NOT APPLY TO USED CHILDREN'S PRODUCTS THAT ARE SOLD OR  DISTRIBUTED  FOR
   22  FREE  AT  SECONDHAND  STORES,  YARD SALES, ON THE INTERNET OR DONATED TO
   23  CHARITIES.
   24    2. INDUSTRY. THE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS TITLE SHALL NOT APPLY TO PRIORI-
   25  TY CHEMICALS USED IN OR FOR INDUSTRY OR MANUFACTURING, INCLUDING  CHEMI-
   26  CALS  PROCESSED  OR OTHERWISE USED IN OR FOR INDUSTRIAL OR MANUFACTURING
   27  PROCESSES AND NOT INCLUDED IN THE FINAL PRODUCT.
   28    3. TRANSPORTATION. THE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS TITLE SHALL NOT  APPLY  TO
   29  MOTOR  VEHICLES  OR THEIR COMPONENT PARTS, WATERCRAFT OR THEIR COMPONENT
   30  PARTS, ALL TERRAIN VEHICLES OR THEIR  COMPONENT  PARTS,  OR  OFF-HIGHWAY
   31  MOTORCYCLES  OR  THEIR  COMPONENT PARTS, EXCEPT THAT THE USE OF PRIORITY
   32  CHEMICALS IN DETACHABLE CAR SEATS IS NOT EXEMPT.
   33    4. COMBUSTION. THE REQUIREMENTS OF  THIS  TITLE  SHALL  NOT  APPLY  TO
   34  PRIORITY  CHEMICALS  GENERATED  SOLELY AS COMBUSTION BY-PRODUCTS OR THAT
   35  ARE PRESENT IN COMBUSTIBLE FUELS.
   36    5. RETAILERS. A RETAILER IS EXEMPT FROM THE REQUIREMENTS OF THIS TITLE
   37  UNLESS THAT RETAILER KNOWINGLY SELLS A CHILDREN'S PRODUCT  CONTAINING  A
   38  PRIORITY  CHEMICAL AFTER THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF ITS PROHIBITION FOR WHICH
   39  THAT RETAILER HAS  RECEIVED  PRIOR  NOTIFICATION  FROM  A  MANUFACTURER,
   40  DISTRIBUTOR OR THE STATE.
   41  S 37-0713.  ENFORCEMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION.
   42    1. FAILURE TO PROVIDE NOTICE. A CHILDREN'S PRODUCT CONTAINING A PRIOR-
   43  ITY  CHEMICAL  MAY NOT BE SOLD, OFFERED FOR SALE OR DISTRIBUTED FOR SALE
   44  IN THIS STATE IF THE MANUFACTURER OR DISTRIBUTOR HAS FAILED  TO  PROVIDE
   45  THE  NOTIFICATION  REQUIRED  UNDER  SECTION 37-0707 OF THIS TITLE BY THE
   46  DATE REQUIRED IN SUCH SECTION. THE COMMISSIONER MAY EXEMPT A  CHILDREN'S
   47  PRODUCT  FROM  THIS  PROHIBITION IF, IN THE COMMISSIONER'S JUDGMENT, THE
   48  LACK OF AVAILABILITY OF THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT COULD POSE  AN  UNREASON-
   49  ABLE RISK TO PUBLIC HEALTH, SAFETY OR WELFARE.
   50    2.  CERTIFICATE  OF COMPLIANCE. IF THERE ARE GROUNDS TO SUSPECT THAT A
   51  CHILDREN'S PRODUCT IS BEING OFFERED FOR SALE IN VIOLATION OF THIS TITLE,
   52  THE DEPARTMENT MAY REQUEST THE MANUFACTURER OR DISTRIBUTOR OF THE  CHIL-
   53  DREN'S   PRODUCT  TO  PROVIDE  A  CERTIFICATE  OF  COMPLIANCE  WITH  THE
   54  PROVISIONS OF THIS TITLE, WITHIN TEN DAYS OF RECEIPT OF A  REQUEST  FROM
   55  THE DEPARTMENT. THE CERTIFICATE OF COMPLIANCE SHALL:

       A. 3141                             7

    1    (A)  ATTEST  THAT THE CHILDREN'S PRODUCT DOES NOT CONTAIN THE PRIORITY
    2  CHEMICAL; OR
    3    (B)  ATTEST AND PROVIDE THE DEPARTMENT WITH DOCUMENTATION THAT NOTIFI-
    4  CATION OF THE PRESENCE OF THE PRIORITY CHEMICAL HAS BEEN PROVIDED TO THE
    5  DEPARTMENT OR PROVIDE NOTICE AS REQUIRED  BY  SECTION  37-0707  OF  THIS
    6  TITLE; OR
    7    (C)  ATTEST  THAT  THE  MANUFACTURER HAS NOTIFIED PERSONS WHO SELL THE

   10  S 37-0715. INTERSTATE CHEMICAL CLEARINGHOUSE.
   11    1. THE DEPARTMENT IS AUTHORIZED TO PARTICIPATE IN AN INTERSTATE CHEMI-
   12  CALS CLEARINGHOUSE TO ASSIST IN CARRYING OUT THE  REQUIREMENTS  OF  THIS
   13  TITLE.  THE DEPARTMENT SHALL WORK IN COLLABORATION WITH OTHER STATES AND
   14  AN INTERSTATE CHEMICALS CLEARINGHOUSE FOR THE PURPOSE OF, INCLUDING  BUT
   15  NOT LIMITED TO:
   16    (A)  COLLECTION  AND  DISSEMINATION  OF INFORMATION REGARDING CHEMICAL
   17  HAZARDS;
   18    (B) COLLECTION AND DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION REGARDING THE  USE  OF
   19  CHEMICALS IN CHILDREN'S PRODUCTS;
   20    (C) ASSESSMENT OF ALTERNATIVES TO CHEMICALS AND THEIR USE IN PRODUCTS;
   21  AND
   22    (D) PUBLIC EDUCATION.
   23    2.  SUCH CLEARINGHOUSE IS AUTHORIZED TO MAINTAIN INFORMATION ON BEHALF
   24  OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, INCLUDING, BUT  NOT  LIMITED  TO,  INFORMATION
   25  REGARDING  CHEMICALS CONTAINED IN CHILDREN'S PRODUCTS DISCLOSED PURSUANT
   26  TO SECTION 37-0707 OF THIS TITLE.
   27  S 37-0717. REGULATIONS.
   28    THE DEPARTMENT MAY ADOPT ANY RULES AND REGULATIONS IT DEEMS  NECESSARY
   29  TO IMPLEMENT THE PROVISIONS OF THIS TITLE.
   30    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
